Context:
Program Name: Business Administration – Human Resources
Code: B144
Credential: Ontario College Advanced Diploma
Duration: 3 years (6 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,464.00 *
International Tuition: $17,496.00 **
Location: St. James Campus
Program Overview: Practical approach to human resources management
Career Preparation: Various careers within the human resources field
Employment Legislation: Design HR policies and programs that adhere
Workforce Management: Attract, retain, and develop a productive workforce
Diversity Management: Manage employee diversity

* Domestic tuition fee for the first year of study.
** International tuition fee for the first year of study.

Programs Related to this Program: Business – Human Resources (B134), Human Resources Management (Postgraduate) (B408), Business Administration – Human Resources (with work experience) (B154)

Context:
The text provides information about a Human Resources program offered by George Brown College's School of Human Resources. This program enables students to work towards obtaining professional designations through the Human Resources Professional Association of Ontario (HRPA). The program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP), making it one of only two colleges in Ontario with this recognition.

The text mentions that Centre for Business students are required to bring their own laptops due to George Brown College's Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) initiative. The text also provides information about field education opportunities and career options for graduates, which include positions such as human resources coordinator, assistant, specialist, administrator, and recruitment coordinator.

EXTRACTED INFORMATION:
- George Brown College offers a Human Resources program through its School of Human Resources.
- Students can work towards obtaining professional designations through the Human Resources Professional Association of Ontario (HRPA).
- The program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP).
- Centre for Business students are required to bring their own laptops due to the college's Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) initiative.
- Field education opportunities are available for students in the program.
- Graduates can pursue careers as human resources coordinator, assistant, specialist, administrator, or recruitment coordinator.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Business Administration – Human Resources Program B144 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The George Brown College offers a Human Resources advanced diploma (B144) program which requires completion of 36 courses: 29 mandatory courses, 4 Business Electives, and 3 General Education Electives. Students with an overall grade point average of 3.0 or higher from this program are eligible for block transfer admission into semester 5 of the Human Resources Strategy and Technology degree program at Seneca College.

Students may be required to take additional courses such as COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) and MATH 1027 (Business Math with Remediation) before progressing to other courses, but these do not count toward the 36 courses required for graduation and will incur an extra charge.

Students must complete at least 3 General Education courses chosen from at least 2 categories: Social Sciences (GSSC), Arts and Humanities (GHUM), or Science and Technology (GSCI). Students are required to make up any failed or dropped courses before graduation. Some makeup courses may be offered in the evening through Continuing Education, but students should check with the business office staff for equivalence to full-time program courses and availability in each semester.

Additional information on the Certified Training and Development Professional (CTDP) designation offered through The Institute for Performance and Learning can be found at performanceandlearning.ca/page/GettingCertified. Students with a grade point average of 3.0 or higher from the Business Administration – Human Resources advanced diploma are eligible for block transfer admission into semester 5 of the Human Resources Strategy and Technology degree program at Seneca College. More information on future study options can be found in the transfer guide.

Context:
The text provides information about various courses offered in a Human Resources (HRM) program at the college, as well as optional streams in Training & Development and Payroll Practitioner. Here is the extracted information:

1. HRM Program Courses:
   - HRM 2005: Human Resources Planning
   - HRM 1030: HRM 1030
   - HRM 2028: Training Design & Delivery
   - HRM 3005: International Human Resources Management
   - HRM 2002: Training & Development, Coaching for Effective Performance Management

2. Training & Development Stream (TDS):
   - Students can pursue the Certified Training and Development Professional Designation (CTDP) offered through the Institute of Performance and Learning upon completion of the following courses: HRM 2002, HRM 1030, HRM 2028, and either HRM 2002 or HRM 2027.

3. Payroll Practitioner Stream (PPS):
   - Students can pursue the Payroll Compliance Practitioner (PCP) designation offered through The National Payroll Institute upon completion of the following courses: BUS 1084, Payroll Compliance Legislation; BUS 1085, Payroll Fundamentals 1; and BUS 1086, Payroll Fundamentals 2.
   - Students must also have a minimum grade of 65% (C) in ACCT 1036, Principles of Accounting, as a prerequisite for the payroll courses.

4. General Education Electives:
   - Students are required to select two Business Elective Courses and one General Education Elective.

5. Business Elective Courses:
   - BUS 1044: Business Law (no prerequisite)
   - COMP 1113: Principles of E-Business
   - COMP 1010: COMP 1010
   - COMP 1115: Business Computer Applications II.

The text also mentions some program learning outcomes for the Human Resources Management program. These include:

* Contribute to the planning and implementation of employee recruitment, selection and retention strategies.
* Administer and facilitate the performance management program.
* Coordinate and support the development, implementation and evaluation of employee orientation, training and development programs.
* Implement and support effective employee and labour relations strategies in both non-union and union environments.
* Administer and communicate the organization’s total compensation plan.
* Collaborate with others in the implementation and monitoring of organizational health and safety policies and practices.
* Contribute to the identification of information needs and apply current and emerging information technologies to support the human resources function.
* Contribute to organizational development strategies aimed at promoting organizational effectiveness.
* Present and evaluate communication messages and processes related to the human resources function of the organization.
* Develop, implement and evaluate personal professional development plans to achieve ongoing competence in human resources professional practice.
* Identify and communicate the human resources component of the organization’s business plan.
* Contribute to the collection, analysis and utilization of data related to organizational performance.

Therefore, the extracted information includes the course names and some program learning outcomes for the Human Resources Management program at the college.

Context:
The text provides information on tuition fees for domestic and international students at George Brown College, financial assistance options, admission requirements, and how to apply.

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $4,464.00 (for programs starting in Fall 2022)
- International Tuition: $17,496.00 (for programs starting in Fall 2023)

Financial Assistance:
- Approved for OSAP funding (for applicants meeting eligibility criteria)

Admission Requirements:
- Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent
- Grade 12 English (C or U)
- Grade 11 math (C, M or U) or grade 12 (C or U)
- Mature students may take Admissions Assessment for English and math or upgrade to achieve credits in English and math.

English Language Proficiency:
- Proficiency in English communications required for success in the program.

International Students:
- Refer to International Fees and Related Costs page and International Admissions page for more information.

How to Apply:
- Domestic students can apply through George Brown College's application system or by mail/in person.

Please note that the information is subject to change, and applicants should verify fee requirements with the college.

Context:
For domestic students, applications should be submitted through Ontario Colleges. International students are to apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. Information sessions are held regularly on campus for attendees to have questions answered, learn about program content and career options, and meet professors and staff.

Contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section for queries related to domestic admission requirements, deadlines, or the application process. For international student inquiries, contact one of the college's international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry via the International Contact Us page.

For financial aid inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid section. To book an appointment with an Entry Advisor for advice on program options, email business@georgebrown.ca or call (416) 415-5000 ext. 2160.

International recruitment representatives can be contacted for country-specific inquiries by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry via the International Contact Us page. For program-related queries, contact Viji Vibhu Prakash at Viji.VibhuPrakash@georgebrown.ca (Business Administration: Human Resources, B144/B154).

Additional information:
- Domestic students apply through Ontario Colleges.
- International students apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
- Contact admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section for domestic student queries.
- Contact international recruitment representatives or visit the International Contact Us page for international student inquiries.
- Financial aid inquiries should be directed to FinAid@georgebrown.ca or the Financial Aid section.
- Contact an Entry Advisor by emailing business@georgebrown.ca or calling (416) 415-5000 ext. 2160 for advice on program options.
- Viji Vibhu Prakash, Program Co-ordinator and Professor, can be contacted for Business Administration: Human Resources inquiries at Viji.VibhuPrakash@georgebrown.ca.
